subject: Create test-patterns and framework-templates references for generate-tests
description:
Create two reference files for the generate-tests skill that provide framework-specific test patterns and templates.

**File 1: `claude/tdd-tools/skills/generate-tests/references/test-patterns.md`**

Document framework-specific test patterns covering:
- pytest patterns: fixtures, parametrize, markers, conftest.py conventions
- Jest patterns: describe/it blocks, beforeEach/afterEach, jest.mock, test utilities
- Vitest patterns: similar to Jest but with Vitest-specific features (vi.fn, vi.mock)
- Common patterns: AAA (Arrange-Act-Assert), Given-When-Then, test isolation
- Behavior-driven vs implementation-detail examples (what to prefer and what to avoid)
- Test naming conventions per framework

**File 2: `claude/tdd-tools/skills/generate-tests/references/framework-templates.md`**

Document test framework auto-detection chain and templates:
- Detection chain: pyproject.toml/setup.cfg → pytest config, package.json → jest/vitest/mocha, conftest.py → pytest, jest.config.* → Jest, vitest.config.* → Vitest
- Test directory convention detection: tests/, __tests__/, test/, spec/
- Test file naming patterns: test_*.py, *_test.py, *.test.ts, *.spec.ts
- Assertion library detection
- Fixture detection
- Fallback to `.claude/agent-alchemy.local.md` settings
- Boilerplate templates for each framework (pytest, Jest, Vitest)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

_Functional:_
- [ ] test-patterns.md covers pytest, Jest, and Vitest patterns
- [ ] framework-templates.md includes the full detection chain from US-008
- [ ] Templates are copy-pasteable boilerplate for each framework
- [ ] Behavior-driven examples distinguish good tests from implementation-detail tests
- [ ] Detection chain matches spec Section 5.7 (US-008) requirements

_Edge Cases:_
- [ ] Monorepo detection guidance (per-directory framework detection)
- [ ] No config files scenario documented (infer from existing test files)
- [ ] Mixed language project guidance

_Error Handling:_
- [ ] Fallback strategy documented when auto-detection fails

**Testing Requirements:**
• Manual: Verify patterns match real-world pytest/Jest/Vitest conventions
• Manual: Validate detection chain covers common project configurations

Source: specs/tdd-features-SPEC.md Section 5.1, 5.7, 9.1
